Seikon no Qwaser is for me an underrated anime. It has 24 episodes and focuses on the fight against an evil group. The one fighting them is a small boy named "Sasha" who manipulates iron (the fighting theme is about manipulation of the chemical elements-just like using iron or copper and so on)...
Well the interesting part is that he gains his powers by sucking from the breasts of the girls around him. Sounds more like a hentai but it is one of those ecchi animes like Queens Blade (if you know it), only that Seikon no Qwaser is taking it a little further. Still youwill only see breasts and such because it is after all an ecchi. Now it is actually a real fun part if you watch the uncensored version. I reccommand it...


Characters and story are all kept pretty simple though. You will see most of the typical anime girl types from shy to bold. But at least it follows a slight storyline.

For the setting, drawing and fights: Setting is taking place around school mostly. Not so much to tell. But for the drawing, I was pretty surprised by the way it looks like. You will enjoy watching most of the girls. And now fights, it is a more episodic pattern of how the fights go but still showing off some nice moves. So some action is also included.


I just want to add that the music was really one of the best parts of the anime. All the openings and ending were pretty catchy and got even better. Even if you don't like the anime, the music is great.


So it might seems like an ecchi trash anime with nothing special in it but it is entertaining...and with entertaining I mean that you shouldn't take it serious if you want to enjoy it. If you expect too much from it then you will fail. If you are into a little more harder sucking ecchi then you can or should check it out. I won't reccomand it if you search for something great or serious. And don't watch it censored if you know what is good for you. Finally if you are a fan of simple ecchi fighting animes then you will like it. I will give it a decent rating because it was overall good enough.

I started watching this series because the concept sounded pretty lulzy - after all, it's about breast sucking and gaining magic powers from it. But I soon realised that this show is literally about nothing albeit petty squabbling over the penis of a tiny exchange student. That being said, everything about it average, especialy the story.
Story: 3
After you get over the whole breast sucking fiasco and get involved in the story, you realise how little there really is. It's about the foreign exchange student, crashing daily student life and the first portion of the series is pretty reverse haremy. However, it slowly degrades into avillain of the week and the wading through that particular marsh isn't worth the very average ending.


Art: 5

Average, it's not bad but not good either. The fight scenes are relatively impressive, and the detail to the breast sucking is well done. The extreme breast physics when he extracts soma from them is pretty hilarious; and the characters themselves are rather nicely drawn and fit with the dark theme. The first few episodes were fairly good, but the art wanes as you progress through the series.


Sound: 5

The first opening is very catchy; and the second one not so much. The endings with all the voice actors is also particularly impressive. The OST is essentially the one of the defining features of this show, as it sets the dark, dreary mood despite the crazy breast feasting occuring. That being said, none of the songs haven't stayed with since the time the show finished - meaning the music didn't have that much of an impression on me.


Character: 6

As per usual, harems have fairly good character development in exchange for a cromulent storyline. Seikon no Qwaser sacrifices even more character development for ecchi scenes. But over the course of the 24 episode, characters were able to be somewhat develop - but no where to the extent of other girls in other, similar length series. That being said, character development is the only saving grace for this anime - because really, there is nothing else. I also hate Tomo - those characters anger me so much. She's so useless and disgusting, yet they dedicate X episodes to give her some sort of use. It's a waste of your time.


Enjoyment: 7

There is nothing more great than laughing at an anime which attempts to be legitimate. This anime has proven that. The concept of drinking breast milk to increase ones strength is absolutely hilarious. I laughed for hours and hours and hours. If this series was 12 episodes, it would've been much more success. But 24 episode of this rubbish? I don't think so. I didn't necessarily look forward to watching one episode every week, but it was watchable. The voice acting was probably the best part of this anime, but much like anime such as Queen's Blade, no amount of voice acting can help you trawl your way through this anime. Though, Chihara Minori's sexy moaning is pretty sexy.


Overall:

This anime promises breast sucking, but unfortunately takes this concept a little bit too far. Getting powerups from drinking the delicious milk of your female friends is pretty lulzy, but using an ecchi as a plot device isn't going to work out well. It's a stimulent which gets your penis going. It is not a concept to be explored; and definitely not the ground for an anime.


tl;dr 

The story is about breast sucking. Watch it for lulz, but if you expect even the slightest bit more, you're going to be disappointed.

Every once in a while you come across an anime that is so far outside the realm of normality that you simply can’t help but be amazed. This can be either for better or for worse but regardless of which it’ll generally leave a more lasting impression.
When it comes to Seikon no Qwaser, it made me feel progressively stupider while I was watching it. This simply has to be the strangest concept I’ve ever seen for a story, but it somehow makes it work. First off I would like to say that this show is NOT for everyone. The term ecchi is nowhere near enoughto describe the extent of SnQ. I’ve seen plenty of quite borderline H anime in my career, but this has to take the cake. The strange thing is that despite that, the way the show uses its extreme perverseness is actually secondary. In reality, Seikon no Qwaser is an action/super power series and shouldn’t even be classified as neither a romance nor a harem series. It just so happens that all the supernatural abilities in the show are powered… by sucking breast milk from women.


The story is very simplistic and cliché; you’ve got your male protagonist surrounded by heaps of women and they’re constantly being targeted by bad guys as everyone is competing over trying to find a lost artifact which supposedly can grant its user the power of god… or something like that. The characters are split into two halves; you’ve got the “Qwasers” which are the supernatural guys who get their powers from sucking breast milk, or “Soma”, from the other supporting half, where the donators are called “Marias”. As absurd as it is, it’s pretty straightforward once you’ve finally accepted just what the hell you are actually watching.


The fights themselves are pretty interesting though. Every Qwaser is unique, as he/she is connected to a specific element on the periodic table, allowing him/her to manipulate said substance at will and use that in any which way thinkable for fighting. The amount of energy available to do so is based on the strength of the Qwaser and how much Soma he/she has digested beforehand.


The character cast is at first glance pretty damn stereotypical. You’ve got the standard harem situation with the protagonist surrounded by a tsundere, an airhead and the silent but loyal and obedient old friend. The protag himself however is not exactly your average one, as he’s a cold hearted, mechanical and revenge driven young lad. Actually when I say young lad I really mean it, he’s basically a shota compared to the heroine cast, and is also a pretty huge tsundere himself. Last but not least, the final two main characters are a bit more standalone… as they share the wonderful combination of a lolicon/yuri/BDSM coupling, and quite frankly they were easily the most interesting duo to watch throughout the entire series, especially the pseudo-gothic twintailed loli dominatrix Katja voiced by Aya Hirano. They also had some extremely borderline H scenes together, unlike the mere constant breastfeeding throughout the anime. As far as side characters go though, they were pretty damn forgettable.


Visuals and audio weren’t anything particularly memorable. The whole idea of basing super powers on chemistry allowed for quite a lot of unorthodox action scenes to take place, but even so the animation wasn’t anything really worth praising. As far as the soundtrack goes, neither the OP, ED nor overall OST comes to mind either. In fact I can’t even remember what either sounded like even now, right after finishing the series. The seiyuu cast and performance was pretty good though overall, albeit somewhat varied in individual quality.


By far the best part about Seikon no Qwaser though is its entertainment value. Coming into this, I was somewhat prepared for that it would be a very strange experience, but as far as the actual enjoyment went, I have to admit I was really positively surprised. I had a ton of fun marathoning through all of this. Even if the crazy amount of boobs plastered all over the screen isn’t exactly my type of thing, in this particular case I somehow didn’t really mind. It’s such an abstract show that I couldn’t help but feel interested in it for the wtf-factor alone. SnQ isn’t an ecchi anime meant to turn you on. In fact, 90% of its sexual showings will most likely creep you out more than anything, but before long you will stop thinking about it as anything more than a supporting aspect of what is in actuality an action series. Hell even the girls themselves don’t seem to act like its anything out of the ordinary.


Overall, despite its creepiness and absurdity, I wholeheartedly enjoyed this anime a lot more than I had expected coming into it. Admittedly though, it’s pretty damn hard to rate, and I can see pretty much any score for it being understandable given how extreme it is, but in the end, the reason people watch anime is for entertainment, and in that aspect at least, Seikon no Qwaser manages to deliver well above expectations.

And I thought Eiken was the most unbearable piece of garbage I've seen from anime. Whereas Eiken had no plot whatsoever in its ridiculously ecchi antics, this turd attempts to create a cookie-cutter shounen action anime mixed in with enough perverted material that made it hard for me to even watch at points. Seikon no Qwaser's gimmick with its ecchi content comes in the form of the superpowered beings called Qwasers having to suck on breast milk to grant them their elemental/ metal manipulating powers. With this gimmick also comes plenty of instances where you can see rape-like situations and moments of sadomasochism from itscast. The problem with implementing this ecchi content for Seikon no Qwaser is that implementing its breast-sucking scenes and other perverted content in serious moments like action scenes and character development make them look more creepy, awkward and uncomfortable than immersible for any sane viewer, and the gimmick really does enough to get in the way of any relevant elements to the title's plot.


If you strip away the breast sucking, perversion, attempted rapes and sadomasochism though, you have nothing more than a typical story of revenge coming from Sasha's tragic past and encounters with the secret cult known as Adepts with plans of world domination, along with a cast of archetypal characters you would see done to death from enough high school/ fan service titles like the clumsy ditz (Tomo), the ojou (Miyuri), the sharp-tongued and manipulative loli (Katja) and the tomboy (Elizabeth). The villains among the Adepts are mostly nothing more than either your garden variety mook serving to get offed by Sasha and other Qwasers or a power-hungry loon who thinks he is better than everyone and wants to rule the world. The first half of the anime mostly features Sasha offing the different mooks of the Adepts and much of the second half is where the Adepts execute their big plan of world domination that Sasha and the other Qwasers have to stop, with the second half developments coming along after some pretty pathetic attempts at comedy with one notable character gaining amnesia for a couple episodes. In other words, the plot to this anime is just one huge excuse for its breast-sucking gimmick and other perverted content.


In terms of visuals, Seikon no Qwaser is rather standard in its presentation with decent-looking scenery and character designs. While animation shortcuts are apparent with this series at a number of points, Qwaser battles were engaging to a degree thanks to the abilities of the Qwasers to manipulate their individual elements. The very frequent appearance of huge boobs bobbing and bouncing around at enough points, however, does kill any enjoyment one would want to get from the Qwaser battles thanks to how annoyingly distracting they are.


Overall, Seikon no Qwaser is nothing more than just another ecchi show trying to find another creepy gimmick to get its sex-crazed otaku fanbase gawking over huge boobs and perversion, while using standard character archetypes and plot cliches as a crutch for its ecchi antics. Unless you have a thing for any imaginable ecchi content, definitely don't waste your time on it.

I originally decided to pick this up because I was told of an action series in which people literally sucked on a girl's nipple for energy to fight, yet is not a porn. In other words, it was out of sheer curiosity as to whether or not such a thing would lead to catastrophe or not. And surprisingly enough, it didn't.
I'll start by letting you know this over the top fanservice will most likely either drive you away in disgust or keep you glued to the screen while shedding tears of joy. I'm sure some people will just laugh it off or ignore it aswell, but it can be pretty polarizing.


Story: 7:/10. The story doesn't really stray from typical shounen plot, but does make use of a few really interesting concepts. For one, it's characters all have powers born of an element from the periodic table (Hydrogen, Mercury, Iron, etc.) and not the usual elements used for this sort of thing (fire, water, earth, etc.) This makes for some rather creative and enjoyable fights throughout the series. Another is it's use of the Christianity in the plot, like a painting of the virgin Mary breastfeeding Jesus containing the power of God. There have certainly been series to do a better job incorporating religion (See: Chrono Crusade), but I'll admit that I surprisingly happy with it considering it was an ero anime.


Art: 8/10. The art for this series is pretty well done, although much of the work clearly goes into breast animation (again, something you either be really happy or really sad about), ass shots. The fighting was rather well done, another surprise for a show of this premise. Overall, I was pleased with the quality.


Sound: 6/10. The "bad shit is happening" track sounded well placed, but everything else was pretty forgettable. This includes both opening and ending themes.


Character: 6/10. Alexander was honestly the only interesting character in the series. With the exception of him, everyone else conformed to some archetype or another almost perfectly. The idea of a of a really short badass who looks like an emo goth sounds ridiculous, but it's honestly the best way to describe him and it worked out rather well. He also has a pretty unique scar carved into the side of his face.


Enjoyment: 8/10. The enjoyment you get from this series all hinges upon how you deal with the fanservice. If you really don't like looking at naked cartoon characters, then this isn't the series for you. If that's your thing, prepare for a full course meal of it.

I would say that if you like hentai with good artwork, some decent characters and an above par storyline, then you should deffinately give this show a shot.

Seikon no Qwaser is one anime that is easy to binge watch. There are a few reasons as to why I think that, but for now lets focus on the series.
The story takes place in Japan, and was told in a somewhat cryptic way. It doesn't really make sense until the later episodes when more things are happening and is tied together. It is a rather simple story, but I didn't find it particularly boring to watch. I found the pacing to be quite mediocre. At times, you can tell a few things were rushed and at other times it felt a bit slow. Thecomedical moments in Seikon no Qwaser were pretty funny while the Ecchi and fanservice were desireable. There were a few tropes that I felt were done right, and there were some that didn't really sit well.


The art style does feel a bit old school compared to other series. It is a bit standard for this style of animation. I think the creator accomplished their goal in setting the mood with the art style. If there was any CGI used in this anime, then it blended really well cause I couldn't tell if there was or not. The style and quality of the animation stayed the same throughout the series, and the animation was fluid.The backgrounds are a bit copy and paste, but fit well for the anime. The character's designs were nice and fit their personalities well. The character's were unique between them, but did remind me of a few other anime.


I felt that some of the voices didn't match the characters. The main male protags voice sounded off to me as he sounded wayy older than he looked and was. The background music was great and fit the atmosphere of the story. I did find how some tracks highlighted certain scenes. I would find myself listening to some of the OST. I didn't really like some of the endings and the first opening was average. I really liked the second opening and felt it fit the show more than the first.


The characters were pretty well made. They each had their flaws, quirks, and strengths. The extra characters reacted to situations in a pretty realistic way which made it more interesting. The MCs reacted a bit unrealistic at some points. The characters did grow, but each in their own way. I found that some characters were more fleshed out than other characters. The supporting cast was only fleshed out on a few, but some were still cryptic. I did dislike the character Miyuri, and I don't think the creator had the intentions of you disliking them. She tended to be quite annoying at times. I do think I will remember some of the characters, but not their full names. 


I do think that others would like this series because of the soundtrack and art. The ecchi parts may turn off people and I can see why people would dislike the series because of that. If you aren't an anime or manga fan you probably wouldn't like this work. I would like to re-watch this anime in the future, and probably watch the whole thing over. I wouldn't like to own this series, and it is kind of memorable. Some scenes from the anime will definitely stay in my mind.


Hope you enjoyed this review. This is my first review, and I hope that it helps you on deciding to watch this series.

Having watched the first two episodes of Seikon no Qwaser I have to say it wasn't a very impressive way to start a series, although I think my reasoning will be a little different then that of my fellow reviewers :)
Story - The plot is a fairly average recreation of a lot of other action/ecchi type anime series, the draw-card of course being that the heroes/villains seem to powerup by sucking breast milk. This didn't bother me that much in principle (ANIME OBJECTIFYING WOMEN?! SAY IT ISN'T SO! :P)  although it would be amusing in the extreme to find out how this can possiblybe explained as leading to superpowers. Having only seen the first two epiosdes I can't say much about the overall story except that its otherwise fairly run of the mill for this genre.


Art - The art is fairly nice, my only complaint would be with whoever designed Tomo. I understand breasts are going to play a big part in this series but really that's just ridiculous.


Sound - Not much to say, nothing stood out as particularly good or bad in the sound department.


Character - Initial responses to the characters is that they are decent, except for Tomo who seems designed to annoy me (is there some weird market for giant breasts on woman who act like five year olds?). Alex is a jerk but somehow I doubt he will stay one for the whole series, and a big scythe is always a fun weapon.


Enjoyment -  This is where I'll get to air my pet peeve with this series and the main thing which made the whole thing awkward to watch and cause a huge dent to my enjoyment. I understand broadcasting people sucking each others chests is probably over the line in a number of ways - but what on earth was the camera doing during those scenes? I get that it has to look somewhere else but you could at least look at SOMETHING in the actual scene, all of those random shots of the sky and awkwardly framed scenes sapped the enjoyment far more then anything else in the series, even more then Tomo (--stab!)


Overall - aside from the drawcard issue Seikon no Qwaser is just a very average action/ecchi/harem sort of deal. Its perfectly safe to watch it but unless it improves a great deal it's looking like a very mediocre series. I will actually play devils advocate here and suggest that if an uncensored version does come out it might improve things significantly by the removal of all those weird camera positions (of course if the whole thing freaks you right out then that probably will make things worse - up to you guys :) )

Anyways, basically this story is about a Qwaser, and it's Maria. The Qwaser is the controller of an element, and the Maria is the one who supplies the Qwaser of his or her powers. There's Many of these "Qwasers". and Our Main Character, Alexander Nikloviech, A.K.A. Sasha, meets many of them, some friends, and some foes.

Sound. 10 / 10

It's very well organized and i applaud the producers for their well-done work! Seeing how this season 1 anime is only 24 episodes long, They've done a Marvelous job at organizing each and every one of the characters! Because many of the characters have either a tragic, or dark past, The development is really astounding! It talks about their past, and switches back and forth between past and present, showing off how they all react towards it. I really enjoyed it, seeing how i'm one for animes with tragic pasts/...Anything related to their past that they'd wish to fix.

-No Spoilers Review-
I'll be honest, I mainly was interested in watching Seikon no Qwaser due to the crazy reception that it has due to it's excessive and unique fan service. You have to go into watching this anime with the knowledge that it is meant to entertain you in ways that other anime don't. 
I was surprised though at how much I started to enjoy the characters as the series played out. The story is semi generic, aside from the element of drawing power by suckling a breast, but it does manage to throw in a few twists and interesting turns along the way. Nothingspecial, but not terrible. You shouldn't watch this anime for the plot. 


The characters are a bright spot for sure and most of them are able to flesh out their personalities throughout the series. Sasha, Tomo, Mafuyu, and Ekaterina are a few of my favorites. The series is 24 episodes long, so a good number of the characters get to be fully realized even though at first they might seem shallow. All of the characters aren't needed for the story, but them being on screen isn't a crutch to the series. You'll probably have a few favorites by the end of it all.


The art is pretty good. Some scenes suffer from less details compared to others, but the character designs and overall illustrations are very good. Lots of focus seemed to be put towards breast animations and detail, so maybe that's why some of the further away scenes hinder. It's nothing too noticeable though and the anime is very appealing to the eyes to watch.


Overall, Seikon no Qwaser is an enjoyable anime if you're the right person for it. If you get offended at sexual situations and nudity, avoid this at all costs. But if you want to watch something different with fun characters and a plot that doesn't need to be taken too seriously, give this a watch!

Hey everyone! This is my first review; but don’t let that discourage you, let me tell you a tale of an amazing anime!  ( ^ . ^ )/
Story: 9
The story in this was amazing, to quickly sum up in a few lines; it’s about a kid named Sasha Alexander who wields alchemical powers and hunts down other “Qwasers” who also can use this power and choose to for evil purposes; everyone with these powers has a specific element that they can control, in literally every way possible. This isn’t the kind of alchemy from Full Metal Alchemist; this is in so much detail thatI was fascinated by how much the writer actually researched, if you’re fed up of boring Chemistry then watch this!

However I would like to note that this anime is in fact an ecchi however has next to no fan service which is a good thing, it contains some nudity but that’s more for plot reasons than actual fan service. For a “Qwaser” to gain energy that they lose from using their abilities, they have to drink the breast milk of a woman, for it contains a magical power referred to as “Soma”, this is for biblical purposes as it is said that breast milk is one form of sustenance that has unparalleled purity as it comes directly from the female body.


Art: 9

The art in this anime is truly great and the characters are drawn very well, the epic feel of the characters wielding these powers does not decrease throughout. Special effects are very well done which goes perfectly with the detail put into the abilities.


Sound: 10

The openings for this anime were awesome, neither of the two did I dislike, I always looked forwards to them at the start of each episode, they both go in well with the theme of the anime. The ending songs were just as great, and to be honest I would easily say that the first ending song would be one of my top 10 endings I’ve seen in an anime. The soundtracks were also very nice, especially so for scenes with action in.


Character: 9

The main character in this is a complete badass, if you’ve seen D Gray Man then you will know he looks exactly like Alan Walker. All of the characters in this are well made, especially so for the antagonists as they all have such diverse personalities and motives. It’s great when you see an anime where the villains don’t have cliché ambitions and personalities.


Enjoyment: 10

I found this anime to be very amusing, what made it so enjoyable was that it was able to switch between making you laugh your ass off and blowing your mind with intricate chemistry and badassery. Despite some of the nudity in this being unnecessary, it did not interfere with the storyline, and in some cases only added to the comedy. One of my favourite things to find in a anime that contains a lot of fighting is where the main character unlocks a new power or uses some skill that make his previous fights look like he wasn’t taking them seriously, this has that effect which made it even more fun to watch.


Overall: 9

To sum it up; if you’re looking for an anime that has comedy, epic fights, awesome powers, and a unique storyline then this is one I would recommend, there’s not a single anime I’ve seen that I can compare this to, as it’s completely different to ones that have similar powers and genres. If you dislike the idea of the anime having nudity then there is an alternate version that doesn’t show any nudity, it being cut out has no effect on the story so you can get near enough the same enjoyment as everyone else.


Hope this was good enough ^ ^

If not then any feedback would be greatly appreciated, cya next time!

So I found this anime a while back and thought it was kinda stupid. I eventually decided to watch it after wanting to watch some ecchi for some reason and it's a lot better than I expected. In this anime you'll be seeing boobs, boobs, a bit of chemistry (huh?) and boobs.
Story: The story is about Alexander whathisname Hell or Sasha for short who comes to this school to look for a powerful artifact. He's a Qwaser that belongs to this secret organization. Qwasers are humans that can manipulate elements such as iron and copper who gains their power from Soma or to put itsimply magical breast milk. Sasha comes in contact with two girls Mafuyu and Tomo after they got tangled in Qwasers' business. Now the plot is pretty generic shounenish with Sasha battling different Qwasers while meeting new allies. Also from the look of the poster, you'd think that this is a typical harem but it's actually not so a plus for that. Now a lot of people will say that this whole show is nothing but pure fanservice but the story is actually pretty intricate with twists every now and then. There's also a lot of chemistry talk so you'll be glad you took those chemistry lesson. In short the story is not the best but certainly not as bad as some people make it out to be.


Character: The characters are somewhat cliche as is with most shounen anime. So we have the MC Sasha who is a badass tsundere shouta with a dark past. Next is Mafuyu who's a a generic tsundereish main girl. Then we have Tomo, a girl with Down Syndrome apparently cuz she acts like a 6 year old. Some people say she's useless throughout the whole thing but that's not true! Her boobs are the biggest so she serves as a the best piece of fanservice! oh and she has powerful soma or something like that. Next is Katja, a twofaced sadist loli who's probably the best character. Her S&M relationship with Hana is hilarious.

There are a bunch of other characters as well, some good some bad but I can't be bothered to name them all. Anyway characters are solid and fit in the story very well.


Art: The art is pretty good but most importantly the boobs are drawn beautifully that come in different shapes and sizes as expected. You know how everyone has the same looking tits in hentai? well in Seikon no Qwaser, everyone has unique boobs like Teresa's firm pink nipples or Tomo's huge inverted melons. The art achieved exactly what it set out to do, which is beautifully drawn boobies. 


Sound: Again pretty good I guess. Both OP are good but both ED are bad. The voice acting is good especially the female characters' moan when they get their titties sucked, better than hentai......probably. The music didn't standout much but then again I was too focus on the 'plot' to notice it.


All in all Seikon no Qwaser is a must watch for fans of ecchi and even shounen if you don't freak out every time you see big round breasts.

I'm not going to write much.
This anime features a VIVID breast-feeding in like every episode.  Honestly, without the breast-feeding, this anime could be pretty awesome.  The actual premise of the anime involves various people who control different elements from the periodic table.  It's actually pretty cool how they portrayed that aspect. Seikō no Qwaser contains… Oops, I misspelt the title. Wait, what did I just write? Seikō? Talk about Freud now…
So, first of all Seikon no Qwaser contains a ridiculous amount of fanservice. It has pantsu, breasts (every size you can imagine, from DFC to “Oh god, strong back she has!”), zettai ryōiki, lolicon, BDSM, tentacles, yuri, cross-dressing… every god damn perverted thing I know about. And probably some I don’t even aware of. I think that idea of Qwaser was born something like…
It was a hot summer evening. Yoshino Hiroyuki-shi, manga author, and his acquaintance Kaneko Hiraku-shi, anime director, were sitting in some yomise andkilling their time with drinking sake.

“I wonder, where does the border between seijin and normal anime lie?” quietly said Yoshino-shi. “I mean, how much fanservice one can put into the show which is not classified as hentai?”

“That’s easy one, Yoshino,” boastfully answered Kaneko-shi. “Just give rights to your latest manga and I definitely will find the answer!”

And so the great Seikon no Qwaser research project started.


Well, that’s not a true story, of course, but a believable one to my point of view. If you’re not into fanservice, afraid of boobies or something like that, then you’ll find Qwaser disgusting, so I won’t recommend it to you. Seriously, you better stop reading my review and go find something less perverted. Don’t waste your precious time, guys. Otherwise… Let’s take a closer look.


In the first place I’d like to point out the fact that this show has an awesome cast of voice actors. To the pleasure of KyoAni fans there are seiyū of Suzumiya, Nagato, Akiyama and Hirasawa Yui, plus seiyū of Roy Mustang and Saber have secondary roles. That’s quite a team, huh? No wonder, the creators were able to make good opening and ending themes thanks to them.


One more good aspect of Qwaser is fighting scenes. They are truly epic. Once main character went battle frenzy speaking lines on Russian (“Moâ duša — èto stalʹ, moë telo — čërnyj metal” and so on), and that was just as cool and pathos-charged as Unlimited Blade Works from Fate/stay night, if you know what I’m talking about.


When it comes to animation, it’s pretty fair. Of course, web-rips have awful quality and the version shown on TV is censored with the help of mad skills, so they are nearly watchable, but now the blu-rays are coming out and they have nice artwork, thus no major complains here.


I suppose one can’t be serious about a plot in this kind of anime, but that’s a complicated case here. Sometimes plot’s really good, no kidding, but sometimes it degrades into “Huh, plot? Screw that, roll the breast-feeding scene!” Sucking boobies in the middle of the battle to get power-up is a bit… disturbing concept, thus it’s really easy to slide down to the abyss of story stupidity. It happened especially hard in the middle (episodes 13 & 14) and towards the end (roughly all episodes after 19th). Oh yeah, by the way, the creators changed stereotypical catholic holy warriors from Vatican into orthodox holy warriors from Russia. Not a big deal, actually, but that’s somewhat refreshing, plus the Russians can find it hilarious. Or they’ll just get angry and beat the crap out of Japan with their rockets and bear cavalry, I don’t know much about politics.


Summing this review up, I’ll tell you what: if you want to watch some anime, which is not bending your mind, full of action and has fanservice, than you definitely should check this thing out. It’ll be worth watching. (There is scene where one girl stops a blade between her breasts. Sigh. The most retardedly hilarious idea ever.) Otherwise, if you’re a Puritan or just want to see something intellectual and developing, than you’ll gonna hate Qwaser and wanna destroy it with fire, so it’s a bad idea for you to pick this up. Don’t even come close to this show.


As for me, this is just another run-of-the-mill anime to kill free time with if you’re bored and have no better alternatives. Just nothing too bad, nothing too good, thus 7 out of 10.

Let's start;
- I found the second intro of the series (Baptize) to be excellent. Aside from that, most of the sound seemed acceptable/unexceptional. Props to the main character's Seiyuu, it is a woman that voices Chimeisha Sasha but she pulls it off quite well.

- The premise is amazing. Using literal elemental powers (Iron, Sodium, Chloro, Bronze, etc.) in magical duels? yes please. The chemistry in the show was one of the best aspects simply becauseit is surprisingly accurate, of course it has much exaggeration but the base chemistry that they're using to explain a lot of their arguments for why something would work actually is substantiated. So if you are a chemistry nerd, this is a good reason to check it out.


- The gratuitous Russian culture/language was cute. Engrish + Japanese + (Attempts at) Russian = $$$


- And we get to the fanservice;

If you have a low tolerance for fanservice, do NOT watch this show. If you like fanservice or are indifferent like me, then know that it has enormous levels of fanservice. It is an ecchi show from beginning to end.



The general plot is obscured by the effing around the main characters do, but it has to do with an artifact being sought by an organization's members called The Adept. This is opposed by the main character's side which is Athos. So basically, two organizations fight for a McGuffin, fights and fanservice ensue.... it is a garbage plot, but the characterization is very good (Chimeisha Sasha is a great character) and the interpersonal relationships are also very strong.


I have not read the manga but I have heard that it has much less fanservice and much greater focus on story/characterization. I wish that they had stuck to that formula rather than what they did in the anime.


Overall, recommend to chemistry nerds that like/are indifferent to mass fanservice.

NOT recommend to people that do not care about chemistry or dislike fanservice.

This one... it's weird. Even for ecchi lover like myself this anime is just odd. I mean sucking boobs for power? Let's move on

NOTE: My review is based on the director's cut/uncensored version.
For those who are lazy to read the entire thing, just read the Overall at the bottom of the page, for those who are not, please read on.
Story - The flow of the story is controlled fairly well. It is slow-paced at the start to allow viewers to get a feel of each character's personality and character, to allow viewers to grow on them. The story then slowly becomes intresting and then gets exciting towards the end. However, like most animes of similar genre, this is where the storyline falls. The "last boss" fight is executedvery poorly, killing off any excitement and causing huge disappointment. However, the story does end off nicely which is rather rare considering how the "last boss" fight was botched. Some other flaws are that at the beginning, it will be confusing to grasp some of the concepts in the anime and that the whereabouts of some characters are unexplained, the story does close off nicely, however, the loopholes in the ending gives it at 7/10.


Art - One word, Fantastic. Details and design of characters, buildings, weapons and even side characters were great, defintely one of the good ones I've seen so far, but that's partly due to the advancement of  real world technology, props to the author for great designs. 9/10


Sound - Audio was good, great OSTs for daily life, battle and scenarios where things get serious. Seiyus/Voice actors did a good job as well, the voices fit the character's personality and brought out their flavour to the fullest. It lost points for constantly using the same track over and over again. If they had the budget for a 24 episode anime, I don't see why they couldn't have paid some more cash for certain character specific themes. 8/10


Character - Great character development. It did not only focus on the main character but also worked on some of the side characters as well. Some of the characters had their backgrounds shown while others had scenes viewed from their persepectives. Overall, characters weren't over developed but also not under developed. It wasn't a perfect 10 due to some of the characters just appearing from nowhere, without us knowing when or where did they appear. 9/10


Enjoyment & Personal Views - I enjoyed the series as a whole. I only wished I had watched this when it aired and not after my exams because it made chemistry so much more fun and intresting to me. The series has potential for a second season due to loose ends with certain characters. The anime has dropped some minor hints for season 2 as well. Part of the reason I did not enjoy watching this anime is due to certain sounds that will give off the wrong impression to others who hear it. 7/10


Overall - The series itself is alright. Those who are intrested in a school life/fantasy/ecchi series should give this anime a go. Though you might want to be discreet when watching it if you're watching the uncensored version. For those who want the school life and fantasy part, I suggest watching the censored version though I don't know how different it is from the uncensored one.

Seikon no Qwaser is an enigma: Balancing action with extreme ecchi; BDSM elements; in-your-face fan service including faux lesbian (and real lesbian) action, panty shots, and bathing scenes; a developing harem for the main male lead; slightly tired character tropes; and an overarching religious theme a la the Eastern Orthodox Christian church, it would seem like this anime would be destined to fail.
The fact that I enjoyed it for the most part and found that the story and characters were much more layered than they first appear makes this much more highly rated than other series that attempt to do something similar (exceptions being, arguably,Rin: Daughters of Mnemosyne).


STORY:


If you stripped the extreme ecchi out of this series, it would seem like typical shonen fare: Special people named "Qwasers" can control elements from the periodic table and two different groups of them, one aligned with the Church and another deemed "heretics",  are trying to find sacred icons that are believed to grant Qwasers enormous power. 


One of these Qwasers, Alexendr "Sasha" Hell, transfers to St. Milahov Academy where Mafuyu and Tomo (two childhood friends with the former being the latter's sister via adoption by the former, now-missing Dean) attend school after he defeats a Qwaser that had been murdering women nearby.  What quickly unfolds is some conspiracy of "heretical" Qwasers known as the Adepts whose motives and actions are shrouded in mystery and blood. 


Enter the reason this series is rated as mature: The source of power for Qwasers is called soma, a magical substance that is most commonly found in the breast milk of women. Naturally, breasts and breast feeding are prominently featured in every episode. The amusing thing is that the women are teenagers or young adults that have not even had children yet somehow can excrete this substance regardless. Whatever, anime/manga logic.


Now this is blatant fetish fuel and the anime takes care to focus in on these scenes with attention and detail that outshines most hentai. The thing of it is though..I dig it. I honestly dig it.


Can I take a moment to explain why I like this anime? Could you bear with me for a moment?


I feel like this anime, while obviously fetishizing the breasts, also at the same time honors it. In multiple instances the act of a Qwaser taking soma from his "Maria" is likened to that of the icon of the Virgin Mary suckling the baby Jesus. Now whether you take this as sacrilege is up to you...


Time and again the Qwasers Ekaterina and Alexandr find themselves in need of a woman's soma to help them defeat their enemies, and each time they take it they show their gratitude. In contrast, the enemies they fight--the "heretic" Adepts--treat women as if they are cattle, simple living sources of soma that are to be milked dry (if you'll pardon the pun) and discarded. 


The quiet reverence that the heroes display for the power that is to be had from the soma they consume is level with that of body worship in a fetish porno. While drawn erotically with blushing ladies that are taken to the heights of ecstasy after offering their breast to a Qwaser, these scenes also contain the creator's obvious homage to the intimacy and closeness that could be found between mother and child. This is a ball of Freudian complexes


Another thing that branches off from this idea and also seems to work with me is how surprisingly genuine the relationships between the girls in this anime are. There are times when LesYay occurs for the sake of enthralling the audience, but the relationship between Tomo and Mafuyu is perhaps the definition of love with a capital L. It is not erotic love per se, but one built upon a kind of understanding and enduring sisterhood and unquestionable friendship that would make a feminist proud. In fact, if you take Mafuyu is Tomo's self-proclaimed "knight" that protects her from harm, as Tomo is just as ditsy and prone to illness and harm as she is sweet and kind. They grew up as sisters after Mafuyu was adopted by Tomo's missing father  


In fact, this anime feels like it's a shade away from being feminist, in a weird way. To me, anything can be empowering to someone if you perceive it to be, so since I think it is empowering, it is empowering.


The most obvious reason for me is the way breasts themselves are treated in this anime. The mammaries that are featured range from nearly flat-chested to Hitomi J-Cup sized. All are treated as worthy of respect and a source of power by Qwasers. It is not necessarily the size of the breasts that determine the quality of the soma, but the woman's emotions and personality. 


Another thing surprisingly and refreshingly absent from this anime are the men drooling over said breasts. There is probably one episode were this was a problem, otherwise it is never shown. While the breasts featured in this anime and the breast feeding is depicted as erotic fetish fuel, to me it is framed in such a way as if a woman wrote it instead of a man. There is little to no focus on how the few men who are featured feel about breasts; instead it is the women and how good it feels or how embarrassed they are. Now embarrassment is a main theme and kink in hentai and BDSM, but for those Marias and Qwasers like Teresa and Alexandr who have been partners for some time, the relationship dynamic between them is like warrior and faithful servant. While the act itself is arousing for Teresa, there is no romance between the two. 


In other cases between other Qwasers and sources of soma, there is a layer of respect and gratitude for the act of taking it.


There are several women in this series who prove themselves to be fully capable and versatile: Ekaterina is a lesbian gothic lolita who manages to reel in punk bully Hana to be her "pet" and "Maria". The relationship between Ekaterina and Hana is that of master/slave with heavy BDSM and pet play, and while it is fan-service-y, there is a real relationship that develops as Ekaterina becomes attached to Hana and Hana herself grows to revel in her "Queen's" brand of sadism. It quickly becomes clear that Hana is a willing participant in this relationship and Ekaterina simply had to bring her to terms with her inner masochist, as Hana saves Ekaterina from danger multiple times.


As Tomo's "knight", Mafuyu is the first one to shield an innocent or defenseless person from abuse. Despite the "bullies" evolving into element-wielding psychopaths, she never hesitates to unsheathe her *shinai* and square off against them and do her very best to at least 


Teresa serves as Alexandr's source of soma and despite being a very quiet and serious Sister of the Church, she is competent with a bow and can land some sick kicks when required.


Lizzie is a tomboy and her skill with her sword is matched only by her enthusiasm and eagerness to fight and train. 


Miyuri, the daughter of the current dean and resident Ojo-sama bitch Queen Bee, reveals a much less narcissistic and self-centered personality where Ekaterina is concerned. While being ignorant of Ekaterina's secretly devilish and manipulative side, she sees the little Loli Doll as a little sister in need of protection, and in some instances her grudging respect for Mafuyu and ability to wise up during serious situations leads Miyuri to extend the same courtesy to her, as well.


Even Futaba, the shy wallflower class president, manages to gain enough confidence to stand up against a particularly dangerous Qwaser.


As I've said before, the relationships among these young ladies, past, present, and future, are actually a bit fantastic to behold as companionship becomes love or at least some level of understanding.


As for Alexandr himself he's a tsundere in every sense of the word. It's in his DNA, and whether it's a result of his past or the fact he's Russian (often referred to as a "tundra brat" by Miyuri a lot)--or perhaps both!--while simultaneously balancing a straightforwardness with rare compliments gives him hints at depth that promote him from being one-dimensional into 2.5-dimensional.


As for the villains, their motivations are as single-minded as their bloodlust is blatantly apparent.  


Personally, personally, personally, I love it. I love this kind of eroticism mixed with what I consider decent character development and neat action scenes. This is an anime that is unwatchable if ecchi is not at all your thing or if you're someone who doesn't consider girl-on-girl action at all stimulating OR you hate boobs. It's impossible to get past the first 10 minutes if none of these concepts thrill you even a tiny bit. Being bisexual and a "breast woman", this was right up my alley.


SOUND:


The soundtrack was surprisingly good. While the first opening theme sounds generic at first, after a few episodes it grows on you. The second opening theme is much more heart-racing and has that sweet, sweet church choir backing up the main vocals, an element I am an absolute sucker for. The ending theme "Passionate Squall" remains to be one of my favorite anime tracks of all time, and its music video features a mixture of erotic bathtub still shots with dream-like scenes of an underwater bedroom and other odd uses of said tub (a boat, for instance), making it much more creative than I would have expected the series to spawn. While the soundtrack otherwise doesn't stick out very much otherwise, it isn't bad or lacking, necessarily, and I'm honestly willing to give Sound a 10 simply for "Passionate Squall", for serious. 


ANIMATION: 


As for the animation, there are some shortcuts that I see but overall the colors are slick and vivid, especially whenever Alexandr is onscreen. As I've mentioned before, since this is an anime revolving around breasts, the nipples are drawn with care that you don't find in most hentai, or even ecchi for that matter. 


OVERALL:


This is my guilty pleasure that at the same time I don't feel that ashamed in enjoying. A girl's got needs (not to mention body hang ups), and this fulfills those needs.  Bless you, Hoods Entertainment, you're doing a perverted god's work.

The concept of sucking boobs for power ups sounded like it would be a good ecchi anime. The characters are bland, or annoying, or dis-likeable. It's a shame such a concept couldn't have behind it a good story, and good characters. The atmosphere is very jaded too, and the story does not make you care at all. Don't listen to the positive reviews unless you want to be disappointed. I urge you to watch Highschool DxD since it is a good ecchi animewith decent plot, and characters. TIP: When I talk about or mention PLOT, I'm referring to ASS & BREAST.
  Seikon No Qwaser, A very PLOT driven show that revolves around a boy name Sasha & his class mates. Sasha is known as Qwaser, a being who is able to control a specific type of element. I found that its easier if you just think about the periodic table. Now associate those elements to the Qwarsers in the show. Anyway- Sasha happens to have the ability element 'Iron' & the only was he can confront any enemy is to have SOMA coursing through his body. Because without it & likemany Qwasers he's powerless. So how is he supposed to attain to the power of SOMA? By sucking on his classmates breast he will. Yes, SOMA is breastmilk. Strange rght? At any rate this anime really does a good job of making a story around breastmilk & how it gives the Qwasers more power to fight. Like many ecchies Sasha finds himself around many attractive girls. But as you continue to watch he only tends to be around 3 girls inperticular. Tomo, Mafuyu, & Kurai. I'll be sure to get into those 3 main characters in my break down review later on. So like any ecchie the PLOT in this show does not over take the main premise of the show. If you plan to watch this show expect a lot of PLOT to be shoved in your face. I highly recommend this show to fans of the ecchie series. I also felt this was also a harem but it is not tagged as such. If you're not a fan of the show I strongly urge you to give it a shot by watching 2-4 episodes, if you're not hooked by then by all means drop it. But I'm pretty sure you'll be hooked by the 2nd to 3rd episode.  Ok, time for the break down.



BREAK DOWN REVIEW; Scoring ranging from 1-10, 1 being dredful



[8] STORY: The story hits an 8 in my book, simply because they could of done so much more with the actual story & PLOT. But with animes only having so many episodes it was cut short in its potential. Nonetheless it deals exactly what you want & how you want it. & I know you what you want or else you wouldn't even have clicked on this show & its reviews.



[8] ART: The art in this show was very detailed when it came to the PLOT which is expected. But some reason this anime did a hell of a lot better when it came to showing you every little detail.



[8] SOUND: The sound like any anime is good, especially if you're watching at 1080. If you're watching at a lower resolution, you shouldn't see much of a difference in the sound the sound as much. 



[8] CHARACTER:


-Hell, Alexander Nikolaevich- Also known as "Sasha" our main male lead. Sasha is a 13 year old Russian boy who takes on the role of a foreign extrange student. When in reality he is a Qwaser on a mission to to find a very important artifact. Overtime he runs into 2 girls & reluctantly befriends them over time. Sasha is a very apathedic boy who shows hardly any emotions at all. But you learn that is due to his past.


-Oribe, Mafuyu- A girl who recluctantly a very important character nearing the end of the show. Mafuyu underwent a sad experience where she lost her parents & she taken into the household of her relative, her uncle to be exact. She ends up becoming very close to cousin Tomo & vows to protect her even if it costs her very own life.


-Yamanobe, Tomo- A huge breasted clumsy girl who happens to be Mafuyu's cousin. Due to her cluminess she is very easily taken advantage of. But when Mafuyu is around it almost never happens. Due to her big breast she is known as "Maria" a high class one at that. 



[9] ENJOYMENT: My enjoyment overall was good. & I have no regrets putting time into this show. It was worth the watch.



[8] OVERALL: Like I mention before if you're into Ecchie this is the show for you but if not then I still strongly urge you to watch it, because I can almost say for sure you'll find it be an overall enjoyable watch. If you decide to undertake this 24 episode journey know that you won't be disappointed when you hit the finishline.

Warning! This is not for someone with a faint heart because you might have a “NOSE BLEED”.
Wow! Just wow. I don’t know if this is genius or unique plot but one thing for sure, I’ve never encountered an anime that has this kind of plot. I mean, they have to literally refuel their powers with some kind of milk or something off from boobies. To be honest, in my 10 years of watching animes, I’ve never seen so much BOOBS in my life with just one series.  If you’re a conservative type then you wouldn’t appreciate this one because there is so much ECCHI-nessin it. Even I myself as liberated and open-minded as I am, is very shocked. I thought I was already use to this kind of things. However, there is actually a concrete plot within it. Let me just say that this is not just about the ecchi part but there is a nice story as well. And it is interesting enough. Oddly enough, you could say that it becomes a lot more interesting because of all the boobs going around every now and then. I say that because there are moments that it is becoming hilarious. Sometimes it just becomes ridiculous that they need boobs by their side in order to power-up. Surprisingly, I am amaze how the too much ecchi-ness part is balance with the weight of the story.


Almost all the characters are involved with sucking or being sucked. They are even lesbians, hardcore sadist and masochist, and lolicon. But for some reasons the characters actually have personalities and roles within the story. They are not just people who suck around but they are pretty much likeable characters. Sometimes they can be so hilarious with all of their ecchi-ness. The character that I love the most is Tomo. She’s just so cute with her so hot body yet have a very childish and naïve personality. 


The animation is indeed one of the best considering it is latest. The characters are beautifully done and the artworks are great. Almost all of the most famous seiyus of today gathers in this series. It just feels so surreal to hear their voices or moans in a very lewd way because some of them are known for their works in wholesome series about teenagers. 


It might not be one of the most wholesome series but you can definitely still appreciate this. If you just don’t judge it by the ecchi part but rather how the ecchi part is use for the main plot. This is not a smut series because there is actually a story. I am definitely still going to watch the sequel.
